p: Hydrodistillation of two samples of wild-growing M. punctata aerial parts gave bright orange essential oils in 0.781% and 0.658% yield. The most abundant components in the essential oils were thymol (RI db = 1289, 61.8% and 47.9%), p-cymene (RI db = 1024, 15.3% and 19.8%), Î³-terpinene (RI db = 1057, 2.7% and 9.7%), and carvacrol (RI db = 1296, 4.5% and 4.1%) (see Table 3).
